required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diclofenac Potassium With or Without Vaginal Dinoprostone Prior to Hysterosalpingography
clinical_study.official_title: Diclofenac Potassium With or Without Vaginal Dinoprostone Prior to Hysterosalpingography in Primarily Infertile Patients: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of our study is to determine the efficacy of oral diclofenac potassium with or without vaginal dinoprostone prior to hysterosalpingography in primarily infertile patients on the pain scores during HSG.

detailed_description.textblock: hysterosalpingography is a diagnosis procedure in the evaluation of infertile women and considered to be the traditional and the gold standard in the assessment of the patency of the fallopian tubes. The major disadvantage of hysterosalpingography is pain. In a study reported the patients complained of moderate to severe pain during the procedure. It is reported that some patients undergoing hysterosalpingography was more stressful and anxiety and effect on pain scores.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean pain score during hysterosalpigography by visual analog scale
primary_outcome.description: pain during hysterosalpigography assessed by the visual analog scale from 0=no pain to 10 = the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be assessed by visual analogue scale 30 minutes after the procedure.visual analogue scale ranging from 0 to 10

arm_group.description: patients will have of oral diclofenac potassium 60 minutes before the procedure plus one tablets of vaginal dinoprostone (6 mg) 6 hours prior to the procedure
patients will have of oral diclofenac potassium 60 minutes before the procedure plus one tablets of vaginal placebo 6 hours prior to the procedure

intervention.description: patients will have of oral diclofenac potassium 60 minutes before the procedure plus one tablets of vaginal dinoprostone (6 mg) 6 hours prior to the procedure by the patient
patients will have of oral diclofenac potassium 60 minutes before the procedure plus one tablets of vaginal placebo 6 hours prior to the procedure by the patient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primary infertility female came for HSG
Exclusion Criteria:
- any patient has contraindication to HSG
